definition: to flow out swiftly/to flood/a torrent/diarrhea/laxative
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison

sentences.english: We c't all live on laxatives.
sentences.chinese: 我們又不用靠瀉藥過活。

sentences.english: A stool softener or laxative may be ordered.
sentences.chinese: 可能要醫矚開大便軟化劑或瀉藥。

sentences.english: It is an advanced alternative of laxative administration.
sentences.chinese: 它是一種先進的替代瀉藥政府。

sentences.english: Antidiarrhoeal medicines, such as loperamide, are not recommended and should never be given.
sentences.chinese: 既不推薦也應從不使用洛哌丁胺等止瀉藥。

sentences.english: Take some purgative and it will help you purge your bowels of bad matter.
sentences.chinese: 喫點瀉藥有助於你將腸胃中的有害物質除去。

sentences.english: The traditional physicians have different understanding to the pathogenesis of formula's syndrome about Tongxie Yaofang.
sentences.chinese: 歷代醫家對痛瀉藥方的方證病機存在不同的認識。

sentences.english: Even taking laxative or enema stool will be discharged.
sentences.chinese: 甚至服用瀉藥或灌腸才能將大便排出。

sentences.english: It has been proven as an excellent laxative source.
sentences.chinese: 它已被證明是一個很好的瀉藥來源。

sentences.english: All they drink is master cleanse and laxative tea.
sentences.chinese: 他們喝的飲料都是檸檬水和瀉藥茶。

sentences.english: Something that purges, especially a medicinal purgative.
sentences.chinese: 瀉藥尤指藥用致瀉劑造成腹瀉的。

sentences.english: The thorn apple has a strong purgative –it makes you go to the toilet.
sentences.chinese: 曼佗羅是一種強效瀉藥它會讓你不停地往廁所跑。

sentences.english: I didn’t tell her that swooning was equally cathartic.
sentences.chinese: 我沒告訴她其實昏厥就跟瀉藥一樣。

sentences.english: She has also been seen hitting all-night drugstores, shopping for laxatives.
sentences.chinese: 還被看到去通宵藥店買瀉藥。

sentences.english: If I eat and I don’t exercise, I will have to take laxatives.
sentences.chinese: 如果我吃了東西而沒有做運動，我就得服用瀉藥。

definition: medicine to be taken after being mixed with water (or other liquid)
to have a snack/to have a bite
to put sb on an intravenous drip
yellow face, emaciated body (idiom); malnourished and sickly in appearance
to desensitize/to remove an allergic susceptibility
effective medicine for a specific condition/highly effective medicine
lit. the disease is cured the moment the medicine is taken (idiom)/fig. (of a medical treatment) to give instant results/(of a solution or method) highly effective
